Can you provide, at least for the standard gripper, an urdf model + moveIT configuration (including IKFast)? In my eyes, this is quite essential if you want to use the MoveIT library with your robot in ROS. Any task where you want to pick up or place an object for example.
Thanks
Hi,
Moveit! motion planning is only used for the 6 axis of the robot. Not for any tool. The reasons are :
So the planning point used for Niryo One is always the end of the robot "hand". From that point, you can use any tool you want with a separate way of controlling it.
I hope this answers your questions. The reasons might not seem very obvious but in the end this is the best solution (for now).
Hey,
I see your points and they make a lot of sense to me, however i have a few further question:
Thanks a lot for the fast repsonse.
Edit: I managed to get it working with the normal KDL solver, so the problem lies in the ikfast plugin, any ideas?
We added a gripper_link at the beginning that we are not using yet, and from the current evolution of things, I don't think we'll change the way of controlling tools.
Feel free to share your progress ! (we'll open a forum on our website soon so you can easily discuss with other Niryo One users)

Since I am doing a lot of computation on another machine anyways, i need to get an interface to my own rosnode running on that machine. Ideally I would like to use moveIT in that rosnode and make the planning on that computer and only send the trajectories to be executed to the robot. How would you attack that problem (i.e what is the additional work you related to)?

Is it possible to somehow remap the moveIT nodes and topics? Or would you suggest running over your robot commander? Or would it be possible to run the desktop_rviz_simulation (from the bringup package) and use that movegroup to plan and then execute on the real robot?
Sorry for the questions but it is a bit hard to understand your full code structure from the documentation here
Well basically, you just need to keep

file in your moveit_config package. The hardware controller (in driver) has a actionlib server, and this config file  allows Moveit! to automatically send the computed trajectory to the controller (trhough the actionlib server).

If you are working with a remote computer, you just need to make sure that messages and services can be sent and received from all your ROS devices, and then the interface between Moveit! and the controller doesn't need any change.
You can also remap topics, this is a ROS functionality. For that please check out ROS wiki.
The basic architecture for a command is "robot_commander" -> "Moveit!" -> "driver" (with controller)

The robot commander was developed to provide a simple interface for all user commands, with params validation, concurrency check, etc. You can skip this and directly use Moveit! with the movegroup class. (python or cpp)

And no worries, I know that the full code can be quite hard to understand, even with the documentation :) This is also due to some other ROS packages that are used but already installed, so you can't see their code here, thus there are a lot of bridges missing if you only read this repo.
contents_details_more: there are many tools that have different shapes and behaviors (not only grippers).

adding grasping functionality inside Moveit! would require to add each object to pick in the 3D planning scene. This would require much more computational power (Niryo One is powered by Raspberry Pi 3) and a lot of configuration from the user. We want things to be simple and easy.
It's much easier to add/switch a tool that way. And anyone can create a new gripper or other tool with instructions
Also, the state of the art in grasping is not much developed compared to 6 axis motion planning
concerning the grasping functionality, you could do the planing (i.e. the collision avoidance of scene objects) on a seperate machine right?

Despit your points made, it would be nice to have the transform to the middle of the grippers in order to control the gripper to an desired object. I saw that you foresaw this in your urdf's by defining a distance variable for the last gripper_link, which at the moment is coincident with hand_link. I tried to change this, since it would make life much easier for grasping something. I recompiled the ikfast library and updated the moveit config, after changing the urdf but i still can not get the inverse kinematic solver to work. Am i missing something here? Could you maybe provide a short list of things I'd have to consider when offsetting the last frame.

Yes you could use another computer (non ARM) to do the planning with Moveit!. You'll be able to get full advantages of all the 3D tools (planning scene with obstacles, etc). This will require some additional work.
Well I haven't tested yet the IKfast plugin with an additional link for the gripper. Did you just recompile it ? You may need to redo the entire package (tutorial

Fixed in commit

issue_title: Prints out low_speed_mode instead of closed_loop_control_on
Cutting communication with soft E-stop button kills node
issue_contents: The firmware of the OpenRover is designed to have a communication timeout of 333ms, meaning if no new motors commands are seen in that time period, the robot will stop all the motor. This allows an Estop button to be put on payloads that sever UART TX tine going to the base which will stop the robot. We call this soft-estop since its cutting communication and not power. There is still a change the robot can continue to move if something is wrong with the firmware.
This act of killing communication kills the driver, so when the estop button is released and the UART TX line is reconnected the driver must be restarted before the robot can be driven.
This issue has been resolved in release 0.5.1

The design intent of the driver is to request the most outdated data from the highest priority list. Instead the driver is asking for all the data from a list. When it asks for slow data it takes 400ms to check all that data back on an RPi, which is longer than the fan timeout in the firmware. So having the driver this way doesn't allow you to control the fan without hitting the timeout.
Ah I removed
from the loop causing it to never check the timers if new data should be loaded. Adding it to anywhere in the serialManager while loop should fix it.
Fixed as of version 0.5.1

issue_contents: This now appears to be working, using catkin_make. run catkin_make in the gps folder and this should all compile. Still needs to be tested with the GPS though

Challenge description: The operator is given the coordinates of a visually distinctive (coloured) small target (weight ~ 100g) within 500m which the machine must fetch and return to a start position. Before collecting the sample they should if possible also place a geologist’s photographic scale nearby and photograph the context).
Design something that can do this which is mounted on the Husky (
). We have smart servos in the bluesat room which might be useful. Ask
to get access to them.

Design on paper is good,  please find any motors or servos you want to use (aka figure out torque requirement and find something that fits that). Please take a picture of the design, upload to shared google drive and comment the link on this issue.
As an extra note, mounting the arm/device off the front bull bars is an option. Also please include any sensor feed back for the operators (they won't be able to see the husky).
A 3d printed arm was build. It used the smart arbotixs servos. The servos had a ros library so it was quick to program and the arm had enough strength to pick up the object.

issue_contents: Challenge description: The robot must transport a small emergency kit (weight ~1kg) to a fallen astronaut, the location of which is only approximately known within a square approximately 50m x 50m. GPS coordinates of the boundaries of this square, which will be within 500m of the control point, will be provided. The astronaut will be represented by a (empty) Marskin suit and helmet and will not be specially signposted. Machines will be evaluated in terms of their speed to locate the fallen astronaut without losing the package.
Design something to complete the above challenge that can be mounted on the husky (
). Mounting on the front/back bull bars is an option. Please include any sensor feed back for the operators (they won't be able to see the husky).
Upload a design (can be on paper - take a picture of it) to the shared google drive and comment the link on this issue.
This was completed and sent to Arkaroola but never tested due to time. It was known as the bucket design.
We have access to a LMS-111 lidar for the expedition and it would be good if it could be rotated so it scanned up and down. Ask
for clarification as I don't think I've explained this clearly in words.

The required specs are: 100 degrees min up and down rotation at 1Hz (start at min angle, go to max angle and back again in 1 second). Need feedback (probably encoder) to get current angle (+-0.5 degrees).
We have van door motors (
the motor is called ‘Van Door Motor’) which might work for this purpose.

Please upload a design (paper or CAD) to the shared google drive and comment the link below here. Please include calculations for required motor specs and ideally some possible motors & sensors which we could buy.

Tutorial
A tutorial that can probrably run ROS across multpile computers.
You need to be in the video user group to control video devices. If you still experience errors you need to run the usb_cam process as root (the rest of ros can remain as a normal user):
sudo -i
cd [a ros catkin workspace]
source devel/setup.bash
rosrun usb_cam usb_cam_node
Make sure the original usb_cam package is unistalled then run:
rosrun usb_cam usb_cam_node _topicName:=cam1 _video_device:=/dev/video0 __name:=cam1
rosrun usb_cam usb_cam_node _topicName:=cam2 _video_device:=/dev/video1 __name:=cam2
to view the two cameras
rosrun image_view image_view image:=/cam1/cam1 ~image_transport:=theora
rosrun image_view image_view image:=/cam2/cam2 ~image_transport:=theora
Final Commands:
On the saber (possibly as root):
rosrun usb_cam usb_cam_node _topicName:=cam1 _video_device:=/dev/video0 __name:=cam1 _framerate:=10 _image_height:=120 _image_width:=160
rosrun usb_cam usb_cam_node _topicName:=cam2 _video_device:=/dev/video1 __name:=cam2 _framerate:=10 _image_height:=120 _image_width:=160
To view:
rosrun image_view image_view image:=/cam1/cam1 ~image_transport:=compressed
rosrun image_view image_view image:=/cam2/cam2 ~image_transport:=compressed

./autogen.sh
make

change line 250 in gst-plugins-gl/gst-libs/gst/gl/gstglwindow_x11.c so that it reads:
gst_gl_window_new (guintptr external_gl_context)
line 445 to:
guintptr
gst_gl_window_set_external_window_id (GstGLWindow * window, guintptr id)
(These are typdefs of the same thing but it fixes the compiler errors, devs probably used a different version of gcc)

issue_title: The most current devel branch doesn't publish messages on Raspberry Pi's
issue_contents: The current devel branch works as expected on TX2's but does not publish messages on Raspberry Pi's. I was also having the Raspberry Pi loose Wifi when I tried to catkin_make with the newest devel branch of rr_openrover_basic and would only reconnect after power cycling the Rpi.
I was able to get catkin_make to build on the Rpi however it still wasn't publishing any messages.

Additionally, after switching the output in the teleop.launch file to log, the rr_openrover_basic log stdout log file is always empty and there is only one. Normally you see 2 log files per node so this might be related.
Lastly, killing the teleop.launch on Euler (TX2) closes all the nodes normally, however on the RPi it hangs on the openrover node until it SIGTERMs to close.
Just reproduced the bug on a local master branch by adding the ros::spinOnce(); from commit
. This spinOnce fixed the message bunching issue from Issue
. Will have to investigate more.

issue_title: High Speed Reverse Turning Sticks robot into pinning in circles
issue_contents: I've noticed the rover getting stuck in spinning circle when you do a high speed reverse hard turn. It looks like the motor speed sent to the rover gets stuck at the last value before sending it a stop command. Probably is an issue with the stopping logic.
Again this only happens at relatively high speeds and aggressive turns and E-Stopping does kill the behaviour and resetting it fixes it.

Kuna meil juba giti terminoloogia eestistamine on aktuaalne Issue, siis mõtlesin, et lisan siia ka ROSi teemalise küsimuse, kuna nüüd, kui rohkem kirja hakkasin panema asju, tekkis vajadus mõningate terminite järele.
Ega seesugust eestistatud terminoloogiat veel kusagil ei leidu?
Katsun siia jooksvalt lisada ka enda poolseid eestistusi, et siis kambakesi saaks nende sobivuse üle diskuteerida.
Panen siia kirja mõningad väljendid, mida juba kuskil kasutasin tõlgitult. Nõustuge ja vaielge siin all, siis saame väljendid, mis enamuse arust on loogilised ja mugavad kasutada :)
Robot Operating System - Roboti Operatsioonisüsteem
Node - Sõlm
Message - Sõnum
Package - Pakk?
Topic - Teema
Service - Teenus
Publisher - ?
Subscriber - ?
Publish - avaldama mingil teemal
Subscribe - jälgima mingit teemat
Navigation Stack - Navigatsiooni pinu?
Move_base - liikumisbaas?
Service request - Teenuse päring
Service response - Teenuse vastus
Roscore - viitan sellele kui "põhiprogramm" (kasutan ikkagi ka roscore väljendit sealjuures)
Distribution - Versioon?
Ma kunagi aasta tagasi eestindasin osasid termineid järgnevalt:
Tuum („roscore“) – jookseb alati taustal, viib sõlmi omavahel kokku
Sõlm („node“) – konkreetsele ülesandele pühendatud programm
Sõnum („message“) – platvormi-ülene muutujatüüp, kombineeritav
Teema („topic“) – sõne, mis annab sõnumivoole tähenduse
Kuulutaja („publisher“) – kuulutab sõnumeid kindlal teemal
Tellija („subscriber“) – võtab vastu sõnumeid antud teemal
Teenus („service“) – päringusõnum ja vastus
Toiming („action“) – päring, tagasiside ja tulemus
Lansseerimine („launch“) – mitme sõlme käivitamine
Ei väida, et minu pakutud on just need kõige paremad. Näiteks mulle esmapilgul täitsa meeldib "jälgima" "subscribe" tähenduses.
package'ile oleks küll hädasti head eestikeelset tõlget tarvis - ise olen mõelnud ka "komplekt" või "kogum" või "punt" või "kimp"
"stack" ei ole kindlasti pinu! See on tegelikult taanduv termin ROS-i terminoloogias ning enam seda väga ei soosita. Võib vabalt asendada ingliskeelse library'iga ehk eesti keeles nt "teek".
Kas "distribution" osas mingit eestindatud linuxi terminoloogiat aluseks ei saaks võtta? "Versioon" ei ole hea, sest peagi tuleb välja ROS2 ja siis hakkame rääkima versioonidest.
"move_base" on konkreetse teegi nimi ning seda tõlkima ei pea, minu arust.
Igasugu kommentaarid, arvamised oodatud!
siin vestluses on ripakil üks arutelu ROSi terminoloogia eestindamise üle. kõik ideed/ettepanekud/mahategemised on teretulnud.
Markitist tellitud, jääb oodata vaid tarnet.

issue_title: can not run two teleop joint cmd at one time
issue_contents: when I run "rostopic pub /elfin_teleop_joint_cmd_no_limit std_msgs/Int64 "data: -1" -r 10" and "rostopic pub /elfin_teleop_joint_cmd_no_limit std_msgs/Int64 "data: -4" -r 20" in shell, some errors occurred.
[joint_state_controller_spawner-6] process has finished cleanly
log file: /home/chouer/.ros/log/220304c4-84d5-11e8-a6bc-708bcd827eeb/joint_state_controller_spawner-6*.log
[elfin_arm_controller_spawner-7] process has finished cleanly
log file: /home/chouer/.ros/log/220304c4-84d5-11e8-a6bc-708bcd827eeb/elfin_arm_controller_spawner-7*.log
Segmentation fault

[gazebo-1] process has died [pid 5393, exit code 139, cmd /opt/ros/kinetic/lib/gazebo_ros/gzserver -e ode worlds/empty.world __name:=gazebo __log:=/home/chouer/.ros/log/220304c4-84d5-11e8-a6bc-708bcd827eeb/gazebo-1.log].
log file: /home/chouer/.ros/log/220304c4-84d5-11e8-a6bc-708bcd827eeb/gazebo-1*.log
elfin_basic_api has only one thread. You'd better send one command at one time.
OK,thank you very much!
What should I do, if I want to do some complex actions by controlling more than one joints on time?
I need your help.

You can try other commands like "elfin_basic_api/joint_goal". The standard commands for teleoperation are two service "elfin_basic_api/joint_teleop" and "elfin_basic_api/cart_teleop" instead of "elfin_teleop_joint_cmd_no_limit". elfin_basic_api supports only these two teleoperation modes. If you want to teleoperate Elfin in other ways, you may need to write some other nodes.
thanks for your answer.
I will have a try using service "elfin_basic_api/joint_teleop".
And I wish I could request two or more different services at the same time.

That will not work. Multiple joints can move at one time (When you use "elfin_basic_api/cart_teleop", you should have seen it). But I think the two existing teleoperation modes may not  meet your needs. In this case, you can write some nodes you need by yourself.
why do you think that "two existing teleoperation modes may not meet your needs"?

If so, I have a question about actions like following a trajectory. You control just one teleop one time when you make it do some complex actions? That means you make one teleoperation for one time step and then another teleoperation for another teleoperation and then and then ...... ?
I do not know how to make it when I need more complex actions. I wish I could control it with some state-of-art AI algorithms, and I think multiple teleopertions may be neccesary one day.
I need your help, please.

If you wanna plan a trajectory with MoveIt! and then follow it, you can use "elfin_basic_api/joint_goal" or "elfin_basic_api/cart_goal". If you have your own trajectories, you can use "elfin_arm_controller/command". These topics are introduced in
. Following a trajectory has nothing to do with teleoperation.

Hi, our arm is out of calibration, i.e., it is not straight anymore in the home position despite the correct count_zeros value. We assume this to be due to pulse mismatch. Do you have a procedure for recalibrating the count_zeros?
Hi, you can move the arm to the straight position and then use the service
to get the current encoder value i.e. the current count_zeros.
Awesome, thank you. We did not notice any alignment marks on the robot - should there be any markings (as on other manufacturers’ robots)?
Unfortunately, Elfin doesn't have alignment marks. We are planning to add alignment marks in the future.
Thank you, I have visually aligned and look very much forward to alignment marks in future versions.

issue_title: 请问在机器人端如何配置？
issue_contents: 您好，ROS这一端的介绍很详细，也看了你们的Elfin5说明，但是关于机器人端ROS编程这一块并未涉及，不需要在机器人端接受ROS传过来的信息吗？
您好，ROS使用EtherCAT总线直接控制机器人本体，不通过控制箱，也不需要在机器人端进行编程。
谢谢你。EtherCAT总线，是你们提供的硬件吗。它是类似PLC的东西吗？QAQ
EtherCAT是总线协议，使用网线作为线缆即可。我们会提供一个转接器，用来把机器人的插头转换成网口。
Hello, and thank you for the great ROS support. We got our robot working in just a few hours.

We noticed that using the ROS controller, the torque threshold safety is disabled, meaning that it's not safe to operate the robot close to humans. Is there any way to enable this? Or is it something that should be implemented in the ROS-driver?
Hi, thanks for purchasing the robot. Unfortunately, there is no torque threshold safety when you use this ros package. So please be careful while operating the robot.

issue_contents: Hello!I have a turtlebot and I want it to explore a room.But I don't how to use your package ! For example, i don't know what the "robot_prefix" should be.  Can you give me A detailed tutorial?Thank you!
You can find the wiki page in the ROS wiki:
Unfortunately at the moment we don't have any tutorials.
Regarding the robot prefix:

If you do simulations with multiple robots, the prefix defines the namespace of the explorer. It needs to be different for each instance of the explorer. If you run the explorer just once (either single robot simulation or physical experiment) it can be left empty.

issue_title: rviz plugin retrieving .ply instead of .stl form DB. Bad mesh shown.
issue_contents: When a recognised object is visualized using the ORK rviz_plugin, a weird mesh is shown, as seen in the image below.
I've tracked the problem to the line:
The mesh_resource contains the URL of the .ply file in the DB, instead of the .stl file.
If I change it to point to the .stl file, the mesh is visualized correctly.
Both files are generated and committed to the DB as attachments of the object by the default object capture and mesh generation procedure in ORK.
In the following image you can see the kinect point cloud in white, and the mesh retrieved from the DB in dark grey.
I have the same experience, I did this little change:
And effectively, now the correct mesh is showing.
I'm tracking down where this info comes from, and mesh_uri becomes filled here:
But I see no evidence of .ply being writen anywhere (I've done a grep -r ply in ork_ros).
Ok, kept debugging, when running the line:
Gave me TRUE.
Gave me FALSE.
So it won't execute the code that references to .stl... so, what is filled in there then? Seems to come from before, maybe at the training/meshing? I'll keep looking into it.
Thanks to
we fixed this issue with this commit:
these lines in doc/source/server.rst (
) should be changed:
rviz crashes when I run:
This is from an up to date source, with no modifications (and with the correct setup.bash). I can't find any reason for the crash in the error files, can you please assist?
The files are attached:
Hi,
Thanks for having attached the log files.
One possibility I think of is some recent ROS kinetic updates that are breaking compatibility. We'll look into it and get back to you soon.
Hello,
Look no more - indeed updating rviz solved the issue. Sorry to bother you, should have investigated further before opening this issue.
To be clear -
Just for reference for future developers who experience the same problem:
The crash as shown when debugging:
Thread 1 "rviz" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff74a85f5 in QWidgetPrivate::init(QWidget*, QFlagsQt::WindowType) ()
from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Widgets.so.5
This is a problem that has to is related to Qt4/Qt5 and OpenCV dependencies that were resolved by the rviz developers in May 2017 (reference:
). This will happen in Ubuntu 16.04 too.

issue_title: Is it possible to use this repo without hardware, only with Moveit?
issue_contents: Hi, I've been using your repo as a reference while building my own application. Excellent docs, thank you so much. They've helped me out a ton. I'm sure this will make Niryo a nice learning platform.

So I've trying to figure out how to connect moveit to ros_control. I notice in your code that you have a "fake" communications base. i infer that this is used to connect and test moveit with ros_control in the absence of real hardware.
Could you tell me how to run and test the code base using just moveit, with no hardware at hand?
Hi,
Thanks for your support.
Yes, you can already use this repo without hardware !
To get the same Moveit! features you need to launch

You can check this launch file, it will launch everything but not the hardware driver and not the Raspberry Pi hardware functionalities. It will also launch the controller (using ros_control) with a "fake communication", which means that the
will just echo the command on the current state, instead of passing the command to the motors, and receiving the state from sensors.
Hi,
I understand that there are higher priorities than keeping up with the documentation for developing in Ros, so I uploaded some of the code I used to get started to a github repo.
It is a basic example for c++ but could be extended with further examples. You are welcome to refer to it as long as you do not have your own examples.
Best
Hi,
Thank you for this contribution ! I've added a link to your repository on the main README, under "Developer Documentation" section.
Hello,
I want ask you if there is complete documentation for Niryo-Panel and Niryo-Shield including schematics and if not, can you add it please?
Thank you very much
Hi,
Yes you can find all the available documentation about those PCBs
on a different repository.

I received my new, assembled Niryo One last week (Dec 28 2018) and everything worked well out of the box.  This morning I booted the Niryo One and requested an auto calibration from the python api.  Here is what happens next:
Joint 0 (at base of Niryo One closest to rpi) rotates slowly to near +180 degrees, then jerks back and forth a few degrees indefinitly like a limit switch is not triggered.
All other joints behave as expected.
Also, I've repeated the experiment using Niryo One Studio with the same result except I could not kill the process and had to do a remote shutdown from SSH to get it to stop.
FEATURE REQUEST: Add cancel to Auto Calibration interface.
Hi,
The issue you have is mechanical. This is probably due to the belt not being tensed enough on the first axis.
Check out
to tense the belt. Also if it doesn't work, you might have a look at
and also
on stepper motors.

For now it's not possible to cancel an auto calibration (my bad, poor design choice from the beginning. We might look into that in the future), but there is a timeout set at 40s so the robot will eventually stop.
Let me know if this solves your issue. For further debugging you can also
directly on our website.
Thank you for the prompt reply.  That was the problem.   I will contact your technical support directly next time.
Hello,
im slowly trying to assemble my robot and now i have problem cause i cant find sizes of alluminium tubes. Can you help me please?
Thank you
Hi hapav,
Could you send a Technical Support request
? (don't forget to fill in your order number).
This is the fastest and most convenient way to contact us for any issue related to your order. Hope you understand! Thanks.
Any estimation when port to ROS2 might be expected? Alpha version of MoveIt seems to be released into Dashing.
For now there is no estimation for when we'll port Niryo One code to ROS2.
Before that I guess we'll port the code from ROS Kinetic to ROS Melodic (Ubuntu 16.04 -> 18.04), which shouldn't take long and is scheduled for the next few weeks/months.
For ROS2 I think we'll wait for Moveit to be at least in a beta phase.

issue_contents: I'm writing proprietary code which wants to interface with the niryo arm. However, it's unclear whether I'm allowed to link against the driver in this codebase because it's GPL licensed (see text
). Would you consider relicensing the driver code under a more permissive license (LGPL) or add a linking exception?
These is a FAQ available
if you want about the GPL license.

For your asking, it would not be possible to modify our license to the LGPL license. And to add a linking exception, I do not have the responsibility/knowledge to give you a yes/no answer but I doubt it would be possible.

issue_title: Reconsider mode names in Drive msg
issue_contents: The latter two are an effort to be more consistent with
All of this gets muddier when we consider that velocity control
should ultimately mean kinematic control with IMU feedback. So
in this context is only specifying the close-loop controlled velocity of the individual motors.
Done via
issue_code:
MODE_PWM -> MODE_RAW or MODE_VOLTAGE
MODE_SPEED -> MODE_VELOCITY
MODE_TORQUE -> MODE_EFFORT

issue_contents: For use within
project's arm planning
whoops, wrong location
First of all I want to thank you for uploading your code. Its been of great help to implement ros_control for my custom robot.
I have one issue though:
Im using ps4 controller to publish /mobile_base_controller/cmd_vel. The output is between -1 and 1.
Am I right if the /my_robot/left_wheel_vel and /my_robot/right_wheel_vel output also should be between -1 and 1?

When I go straight forward or backwards /my_robot/left_wheel_vel and /my_robot/right_wheel_vel output always is -1 or 1. In other words full speed backwards or full speed forward. Even when _/mobile_base_controller/cmd_vel output is e.g. 0.5.
When turning /my_robot/left_wheel_vel and /my_robot/right_wheel_vel output is working perfectly between -1 and 1 according to ps4 cmd_vel.
Have you any idea on where to start looking?
Thanks
Andreas
Hi Andreas, I didn't understand something. Is your PS4 controller node output between -1 and 1?
Also, if I remember correctly, the wheel velocity topics are used on the real robot, not the simulation.
There is a difference between cmd_vel and those velocities because the first one it's the command for the robot, and the others, for each wheel. The first two equations
show you the difference.
HTH, Emiliano.
Yes, my ps4 controller node output is between -1 and 1 on the cmd_vel topic.

I'm running this on a real robot. I use an arduino to subscribe to /my_robot/left_wheel_vel and /my_robot/right_wheel_vel. Because I only get wheel_vel between -1 and 1 I multiply it by 255(which is max pwm input on motor driver)
Even if I use "rostopic pub -r 100 ... /mobile_robot_controller/cmd_vel..." with x value bigger than 1 the wheel_vel is never greater than 1 .
Could you send me a picture of your
showing all the nodes/topics?
Did you check that the
is working correctly if you set the velocity values directly through the terminal instead of using the PS4?
This node is generated by the package
and creates a ROS layer that receives topics to move your custom hardware. I found that
sets the maximum output velocity. You should change it.
This code could contain bugs because I didn't have time to debug it a lot.
If you see
, you will find that I'm using a double to receive the velocity commands on the Arduino. But on another repository I have a
(sorry for the mess, I think I didn't update this repo yet) where I used UINT16 as output format (0-255).  I recommend you to change the file
file so both codes can interact with each other.

Another thing that you can do is to leave the controller_manager code as it is now and modify the Arduino node in order to receive velocity commands in rad/s and you will need to create a function that satisfies a condition like

Ok! The problem was a combination of the speed limit and me being confused with what values(range of values) to write and read on the cmd_vel and wheel_vel topics. I can now continue adapting your code to my own robot. Thank you very much!
Great, I hope you can get it work and if you think that any of your changes can help this repo, feel free to create a PR!

Better documentation is needed for:
Need to point to the right location for

Load the haar cascade from /usr/share/opencv/haarcascades/haarcascade_frontalface_alt.xml. This is the location in Ubuntu 14.04 with OpenCV 2.4.8. Ideally, there would be a way to get this programmatically, but it's not clear how to do that.
Do you know a programmatic way to do this?
no way as you can specify different share folders at install time. The easiest is to have code that tries different locations.
In that case, let's just release as-is. We can update share locations when/if people file issues.
via
Anything holding us back from releasing in indigo?
Compiles fine for me in indigo/14.04, but it looks like OpenCV's haar cascade xml file may have moved. I'll investigate and create an issue/PR if appropriate.
With
resolved, I'm ready to release into indigo unless we want to split off social_navigation_layers first.

issue_title: Random Leg Probabilities due to Incorrect Copy of Features
issue_contents: With the current kinetic version we were not able to get reasonable leg probabilities.
I looked into the changes since OpenCV and found a major bug in
that was introduced with
Here
values are assigned to
This messes up the whole feature vector and thus the classification becomes basically randomized.
Also the probability calculation looks wrong to me.
Right now it is:
As fuzzy_value is between the classes -1(rejection) and 1(leg) the resulting probability would be between -0.5 and 1.5.
You can find our fixed version here:
As there are multiple changes(that are already pretty old but increased the quality of tracking).
I will try to find time to create a pull request that at least fixes the major bugs.

to ROS 2 Dashing?

issue_contents: Hi,
How can I solve this particular problem?
Thanks in advance.
I have been building
in dashing from source, but it'd be fantastic to have them available via debian install. Is there any chance for a Bloom Release of the
repo in the near future? Thanks!
What are you doing with
in ROS2?
In current codes,
and
subscribe
. The reason is 'jog' should be commanded by the differential displacement from current position. And it is used to calculate target joint angle with jog command continuously.
However,

keeps changing while moving. So if we command by five jog messages by 1mm, it doesn't guarantee 5mm motion. In addition, some robot is controlled by low gained position control like Baxter, so it is easily flowed from desired cartesian trajectory.
The problem is the nodes shape control loop from
to joint command. We can define 'jog session', which is started and ended by the jog commands to avoid the control loop.
should be the solution. We need tests soon...

issue_title: Setup problems with Kuka industrial arm
issue_contents: Hi,
I am trying to set this package up to use with the Kuka KR16 arm but am having some problems with the controllers.
I have been trying to follow the UR5 example. I have a launch file which sets up the Gazebo, Rviz and MoveIt! with the controllers:
I then have the
node being launched in a separate launch file as it was causing some issues in the previous launch file:
The problem I'm having is that the
node is giving this error:
Do I need to set up a server? If so, how do i do this?
Thank
Cross-posted:
to ROS Answers.
Thanks!
Obviously it is not the problem of jog_control package as I mentioned in ROS Answers. Feel free to create new issue here, in case MoveIt! works correctly for your robot, and jog_control doesn't.
I posted a solution to this on the ROS Answers link above
issue_code:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<launch>
  <arg name="limited" default="false"  doc="If true, limits joint range [-PI, PI] on all joints." />
  <arg name="paused" default="false" doc="Starts gazebo in paused mode" />
  <arg name="gui" default="false" doc="Starts gazebo gui" />
  <arg name="sim" default="false" doc="If true, use the simulated joint controllers"/>
  <arg name="use_moveit" default="true"/>
  <arg name="use_rviz" default="true"/>
  
  <!-- startup simulated world -->
  <include file="$(find gazebo_ros)/launch/empty_world.launch">
    <arg name="world_name" default="worlds/empty.world"/>
    <arg name="paused" value="$(arg paused)"/>
    <arg name="gui" value="$(arg gui)"/>
  </include>

  <!-- send robot urdf to param server -->
  <param name="robot_description" command="$(find xacro)/xacro --inorder '$(find kuka_kr16_support)/urdf/kr16_2.xacro'" />

  <!-- push robot_description to factory and spawn robot in gazebo -->
  <node name="spawn_gazebo_model" pkg="gazebo_ros" type="spawn_model" args="-urdf -param robot_description -model robot -z 0.0" respawn="false" output="screen" />

  <!-- spawn the joint_state_controller and joint_trajectory_controller-->
  <rosparam file="$(find kr16_moveit_config)/config/ros_controllers.yaml" command="load"/>
  <node name="arm_controller_spawner" pkg="controller_manager" type="spawner" ns="kuka_kr16_2" args="joint_state_controller arm_controller" respawn="false" output="screen"/>

  <!-- Remap joint_states -->
  <remap from="/joint_states" to="/kuka_kr16_2/joint_states"/>

  <!-- Robot state publisher -->
  <node pkg="robot_state_publisher" type="robot_state_publisher" name="robot_state_publisher">
    <param name="publish_frequency" type="double" value="50.0" />
    <param name="tf_prefix" type="string" value="" />

  </node>

  <!-- Launch rviz -->
  <node if="$(arg use_rviz)"
	name="rviz" pkg="rviz" type="rviz"
	args="-d $(find jog_launch)/launch/jog.rviz"/>


  <!-- Remap follow_joint_trajectory -->
  <remap if="$(arg sim)" from="/follow_joint_trajectory" to="/kuka_kr16_2/arm_controller/follow_joint_trajectory"/>

  <!-- Launch MoveIt! -->
  <include if="$(arg use_moveit)"
	   file="$(find kr16_moveit_config)/launch/move_group.launch"/>

</launch>

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<launch>
  <!-- Remap joint_states -->
  <remap from="/joint_states" to="/kuka_kr16_2/joint_states"/>

  <!-- Remap follow_joint_trajectory -->
  <remap from="/follow_joint_trajectory" to="/kuka_kr16_2/arm_controller/follow_joint_trajectory"/>

  <!-- Launch jogging node -->
  <rosparam command="load" file="$(find jog_launch)/config/kr16_jog.yaml"/>
  <node name="jog_frame_node" pkg="jog_controller" type="jog_frame_node" output="screen">
    <param name="use_action" value="true"/>
  </node>

</launch>

issue_contents: Hi,

I'm trying to change the base_link at run time, just like in the rviz jog_frame_panel, I'm thinking of using a ROS service. I'm a bit confused about where I should implement it. Should dynamic reconfigure be implemented in the jog_frame_node of in the joy_to_jog_frame node?
Do you mean you want to set the reference frame (origin) of the target link at run time? I'm using JogFrame message for such purpose, so why don't you use it?
In this message header.frame_id must be set as a reference frame (ordinary base_frame). If your intent is different, please let me know.
That's what I was looking for, thank you!

Thanks !!  I will try catkin tools. If you mean that catkin tool can solve the problem?
I just have a rough overview of your papers and videos, there are several questions below, hoping to get your answer:
1, to the robot emergency map size and the actual map is 1: 1? Given an emergency map of any size, does the algorithm adjust the scale when perceived in the real world?
2, the navigation target is previously given to the robot ? （Do robots know the location of the person to be rescued?）

3, I do not know where in the paper is: Figure 9a, The robot found a path to a room in the emergency map that was not yet visited by the robot.The target point is the person specified or robot found? Figure 9b,The robot added a door that wasn’t closed in the emergency map and the path can not be found anymore . will it automatically plan a new path?
Expression is not clear, please forgive me！
I mean you can ignore the problem by not compiling that project that is unnecessary ;).

The emergency map is read from an image. The image is not scaled down and might be huge. However it will be scaled down by the initialization where you need to provide it with 2 (or 3 I don't remember) common points between the emergency and the robot map. Use the "Publish Point" Function of Rviz for that. One click on the emergency map, followed by a click on the robot map and so on.
. The only thing done is the map matching and optimization. You have to find a way to handle the navigation yourself :).

Those figures are just example: A path was found toward an unexplored place but there was no victim or even reason for the robot to go there in the image. It was just a random place in the unexplored environment. Replanning will depend on your navigation algorithm.
Ok,I got it. Tomorrow l will try run it in my computer.
So, this algorithm just map match,right?
Thank you for reply me!
Pretty much, yes. The algorithm fits inconsistent maps onto each other given a coarse matching ;).
If the algorithm can correct the old map according to the real world?
I think I'm confusing you more than I'm helping right now
As written in the read me:
a method to integrate an emergency map into a robot map, so that the robot can plan its way toward places it has not yet explored.
It will correct the emergency map to fit what the robot mapped.
I got it now . In Short，It‘s a match algorithm from emergency map to real world
Thanks for your all reply, If I have question I will reply you ：）
In the video,Is multi-robots ?
Is this a usable version?
Yes
Just as an update, since this code is "old" now, You should use it with this code on perception_oru from the same date. I'm going to update the readme for that

: we're currently preparing some user documentation for setting up and operating the ros_canopen driver. Will be online at
: any hints in the meantime?

As far as I found out the code 100 is defined in
as:
The baudrate is 500K.
It is better anyway to use the Kernel(SocketCAN) driver for PEAK. Could you please try the following?:

it works):

issue_title: read current from the schunk lwa4p
issue_contents: Hi!
I think it can be done after reading the Control_motion.pdf from schunk, however I would want to know if it is actually implemented now somehow as a ros service..
Afaik we do not read the current....and we also don't have a usecase for it...
But we are always happy to accept new features via a PullRequest.
There is no ROS service for it, this would not make any sense for continuously changing data.
You can map the current to efforts in joint_states (
) or you could publish the corresponding objects on a separate topic (
Please note that you have to alter the PDO mappings in the DCF in both cases.
this question is sufficiently answered
close due to inactivity

issue_title: Errors 'CAN not ready' when init Schunk lwa4p in Indigo
issue_contents: Hi,

I am trying to move the schunk lwa4p arm using the package of indigo version. But errors like 'CAN not ready' 'message: cannot reset node ' '' frequently appear when I call the service /arm/driver/init.
The configuration status is:
-Ubuntu 14.04  64-bit
-ROS-Indigo (the most recent update)
-SocketCAN(peak_usb)
-The schunk_robots and ros_canopen repositories are the most recent ones.
The program running order:
rosrun canopen_test_utils prepare.sh;
roslaunch schunk_lwa4p robot.launch;
rosservice call /arm/driver/init(OR roslaunch schunk_lwa4p dashboard.launch).

I considered it as an issue of time sequence, as I found that the Sync, SDO and PDO running simutaneously like chaos. So I delayed the sync starting time after the SDO initialization finished(not completely, except the last node), by adding a conditional flag in the function of switchState() in the
in the package of canopen_master, as follows:
int delay_flag=0;
case Operational:
delay_flag++;
if (delay_flag==6) {
delay_flag=0;
if(changed && sync_) sync_->addNode(this);}
break;

The current status is: as long as I have tested, it fails at the first one or two tries(relaunch the robot node) every time I restart the arm, but after that it works stably(no errors and can move the arm).

I considered it as an issue of time sequence, as I found that the Sync, SDO and PDO running simutaneously like chaos

Sync starts after the first CANopen node is operational.

and the

The sync rate is specified in the
parameter.
And the behaviour is implemented in the sync layer (
Back to your init problem:
The nodes were initialized properly. The init service should have responded with success=True.
However, the CAN layer stopped right after the drive mode was switched.
A txqueuelen of 20 should work for you. Please double check the value with
or

I guess you mix some things up.
Lines 475 too 499are fine.
starts node 7
Does not belong to the initialization. This is part of the asynchonous diagnostics job that polls the error register of all initialized nodes.
Resets the error counter for node 7.
And please stop sending attachment via e-mail, use
instead.
That way other can keep track of the conversation as well.

Can explain this a little more?
Do you restart the arm while the driver is running?

yes, I restart the arm while the driver is running: what I did is, i turned off all the power switches of the manipulator and then turned on, leaving the pcan usb plugged into the computer, then carried on the next test(run prepare.sh and launch robot.launch).

Usually the first time you launch the robot node, errors like “CAN not ready”. Then stop the robot node, run the prepare.sh and relaunch the robot node agian, it will work well without errors. After that, you stop and start the robot node repeatedly, all works well, until you restart the manipulator again.
Please try to run prepare.sh before you power on the robot.
The robot sends boot-up messages at start-up and it might lead to problems if these are not read from the bus.
It addition I recommend the network device in the config (
) and to run prepare.sh only if you really need to restart the kernel driver for the device.

in my fork for the changes.

issue_title: Do you have a plan to release on ROS Kinetic version?
issue_contents: Hello! I'm a researcher in ROBOTIS. I have a plan to release the Thormang3 packages (kinetic version,
). So, your footstep_planner package is very important for us. Do you have a plan to release on ROS Kinetic version?
I am no longer working actively on the footstep planner, so there are no plans for future releases (from me at least).
Thanks for a reply. I think that your packages are very important for the researcher on the humanoid robot. So can I be maintainer your footstep_planner package?
You're welcome to fork the repo and continue developing there.
Note that there hasn't been an official release as catkin package yet.
Thanks,
. I truly appreciate your time and effort.
I'm also interested in this stack (though I'm specifically interested in costmap_2d package)
Do you have any plans on releasing this through ROS build farm?
, I don't care! But, do you know that the "sbpl(
)" package is dependency package of this package? It is also not released on Kinect version.

So I understand that you have no plans on getting this package released on ros build farm. So I will plan to get this released on ros build farm by submitting a request and will see whether it gets accepted.

Regarding sbpl. My requirement is to get humanoid_navigation released on indigo. Fortunately sbpl is released for that. Later I may see whether I can get these two released on kinetic. Will update if I have any progress on these.
Note: I have released this package in indigo through ros build farm and now prebuilt binary packages are available through ros package repository. I'll check if I can release for kinetic as well.
I have noticed that you have accepted couple of bug fixes after my initial release over ros build farm.
I plan to first merge changes I had to do for a indigo release as a catkin package to your repo before further releasing.
Would you have time to accept if I opened a pull request to your repo?
Sure, although I'm not working on it anymore. So best would be to merge into your repo and release from there.

issue_title: Installing the correct version of FastRTPS for ROS2
issue_contents: The
for installing eProsima/FastRTPS installs the wrong version of FastRTPS for ROS Bouncy. (1.5.0 instead of 1.6.0) which causes
to complain that it does not recognize the command line arguement
when you build the ros2 branch of px4_ros_com.
For ROS2 Bouncy you should install 1.6.0 and for ROS2 Crystal you should install 1.7.0.
Being addressed on scripts now, but should be simplified so to only get the
script.
I've been working on a new approach for this with

that leverages the ROS 2 typesupport packages and is working toward being more generic such that the agent does not have to hard code the topics and types.  It works with the binary installed version of fastrtps.
Could you take a look at:
We're currently backwards compatible with your implementation but expect to add more features and robustness are planning to evolve the protocol. For example:
and add dynamic topic support:
instead of just having the yaml file defining the topics as we have now.

really interesting! Could it be something that could back the agent implementation on this package? Meaning a package that is added as a dependency of this package that then subscribes to the uorb data being published after serialized by CDR?
Yes, at the moment it should be a drop in replacement for the agent in this package.
Alright. I will take a look at it. Thank you
This is already addressed on the containers and documentation.

first, and to close the main issue reported here: I tested the bridge with the changes in
and it fixes it.

About the CRC issues: what you are reporting is completely normal considering that in the same UART link, you are sending both Mavlink and RTPS packets. As there's no protocol splitter on the agent side, the amount of CRC errors will be large because the agent is trying to deserialize Mavlink messages as they were RTPS messages, which will endup on the link to fail.

While a protocol splitter (for the agent, since in the PX4/client side it already exists) is still on the works, what you need to do is to stop the Mavlink stream instance you have on the port you are connecting and just launch the
for that same port. If you need both Mavlink and RTPS on your Beaglebone, you need
, one for the Mavlink stream and another for the RTPS stream.

Even if you get some CRC errors on the RTPS only stream (which are normal, depending on the stability of the link), you will see that the link works as expected and you can subscribe to the RTPS topics (ex:
I am closing this issue since the initial reported issue was fixed. If you have questions about the second part (CRC and dual link), please bring those to the PX4 Slack #messaging or #ros channel.
Thanks

is used to micrortps bridge and
for mavlink.

, I am quite surprised to have different message locations. Any other user experienced the same problem? Is there any possibility to specify a different location for the idl messages?

what exactly steps are you following to build the code. A reminder that you should have Fast-RTPS 1.7.2 built and installed from source, and you need to use ROS2 Crystal, as we are still working on adding support to ROS2 Dashing.

issue_title: Doesn't seem to work with robot on local network
issue_contents: Even when trying the demo page, I can see topics if running a local rosbridge server on same machine (127.0.0.1), but not a robot in the local network, for example 10.66.171.50. The dashboard banner goes green but gets stuck in "Loading" with no further information.

Correction to the above. It seems to work only when running a simple server on my laptop, but when I plugged a monitor to the robot (so the ws server lived on 127.0.0.1:9090) and tried to open the web demo, I got the same result, i.e., got stuck in the "loading..." bubble.
https:// to ws:// is disallowed by default on firefox.
Go to firefox's about:config and toggling network.websocket.allowInsecureFromHTTPS to true
Thanks!

Actually you need to launch two things, after setup:

And If it is not working like that: it could be, that you have no connection from EV3 to your PC. Because ROS requires a DNS to work normally. If you do not have a DNS in your system - which makes it possible to do for example ssh root@ev3dev instead of ssh root@192.168.0.23 - then you need ROS ip. And then you set the ROS master URI to something like http://IP_OF_YOUR_PC:11311 and use the rosip command to set the rosip on the brick and you also need to export it on your pc like export ROS_IP="IP_OF_YOUR_PC".
See also (it is basic ros stuff):

Nice, you are welcome ;-)

Well you need a joy node connected to a node which translates the joystick to speed around z and along x axis and outputs a topic mostly called /cmd_vel (geometry_msgs/Twist) and to launch a dual drive controller using two joints on the EV3.
Those nodes are mainly called teleop (teleoperation) there should be many around:
Example:
(joy)--/joy-->(teleop)--/cmd_vel---->(ev3_manager with diff drive)

After a little break, i'm trying to get my robot running again, the teleop node is running fine, but i have no idea, how i have to use the /cmd_vel topics now to get my robot working. I never worked with ros_control, so i'm very grateful for your help!
Does it publish messages to the right topic? Do you receive the messages on your EV3?

i can echo the /cmd_vel topic on my EV3, so no problem there. What i don't understand is, what i have to do after that to have my motors running. You said, i need a diff_drive controller to use the topics, but what type of controller is working, when i start ev3_manager on my EV3. What type of messages to i have to publish to get it working?
I am feeling like i am on my last step to get it running, just need some little help to run the EV3 motors with the /cmd_vel topics

Well the thing is you need to create launchfiles which load the motors. Those launchfiles are executed on your PC. They advice the ros control manager in the ev3_manager to load shard libraries. You supply arguments to it by the yaml setting file or parameters in the launchfile. Those parameters define, what controller is loaded and which topics the controller uses. So if you load controllers the ev3_manager node will spawn publishers and subscribers depending on the controller.
Just saw there is also an issue with the examples, but this should do:
motors.yaml is in h4r_ev3_launch. You can copy it to yours and change the name in the rosparam line
Motors are set to be connected to Port C and D there.
issue_code:
<launch>
    <group ns="$(arg ev3_hostname)">
        <!-- Load joint controller configurations from YAML file to parameter server -->
        <rosparam file="$(find h4r_ev3_launch)/config/motors.yaml" command="load"/>
        <!-- load the controllers -->
        <node name="controller_spawner" pkg="controller_manager" type="spawner" respawn="false"
        output="screen" args="OutPortState diffDrv "/>
    </group>        
</launch>

I do not have an Idea about your whole setup but this is a common problem if you have multiple machines running ROS.
If you have DNS you are probably fine - if you don't - setup ROS_IP on all systems. Use ip_address as hostname.

Probably you do not have DNS in your local network. Otherwise it would probably work. (Problem: Brick does not resolve your computers hostname to IP). You could add your computers IP in /etc/hosts or use ROS_IP instead.
Probably ROS_IP is not set on your computer.

glad to here you are interested in object analytics package, of course you could try to use it. If any issues, please feel free to let us known.

. The goal is to make a device for a person who is visually impaired. And honestly I am very new to ROS. Kindly help me for the same. And where can I find a Gazebo plugin with object detection code? Thanks, again.
sorry but we have no Gazebo plugin right now. You may need Intel Realsense Camera or other camera device. About object detection, you could reference
, object analytics used detection msg published by ros2_intel_movidious_ncs

R200 is an old model that our modules NCS/OA have not supported, we only support D400+ series. About Gazebo plugin, here is a package
, but we have not verified object detection/tracking/localization in Gazebo simulation yet.

took a very long time for at least 4 hours. During which, the whole computer will freeze even the mouse is non-responsive. The only sign of the system is alive is the hard drive status LED. And the compiler crashed with following report. Try
again at this status, building process will pass in around 15 seconds on a i7-6700TE computer.

no special compiler flag but only use command as
. It took about 1~2 minutes to build the package on my local with i7-6700 and 16G mem.

) in

do get proper bounding box info published.

to
in the object_analytics_node directory.

flag, this time, everything worked as long as I manually launch everything.

and their related issue.

branch commit

issue_title: Flashing tracking boxes except for the first tracking object.
issue_contents: I'm working on branch
, commit
. And encounter this issue.
I've open a image viewer with
for a better view of tracking result.
I've notice that in the image viewer, as well as the rviz2 built-in one, the tracking boxes flash rapidly except for the left-most object. Please check the screen recording:
In this video, at first, you can see that every bounding box is flashing except for the left-most "chair".

At 00:20, I've purposely blocked that object, and now the tracking box is "lock" on me. And when I'm moving, the tracking box on me is still stable even I'm not the left-most object. The left-most chair is flashing now.

At 00:45 I jump out of the frame, and the moment my bounding box disappeared (00:48), the left-most chair resume "locked" status while other boxes flashes. The behavior persisted even I moved back into the frame.
The video is much less "flashy" than on the monitor, probably due to screen recording frame rate.

I'm not sure is this a display bug or a tracking bug, but it appears to me that "persistence tracking" is only performing on the first "target object'. And that target object is selected from the left side of the frame (which is probably the order the object detection presents its detected list.)
Seems your video stream is not valid for us, could you have a check?

Roughly speaking, tracking doesn't favor any specific object, the splash may due to detection/tracking missing/glitching from frame to frame. But from your description, we would like to check if any improvement can be made from image_publisher side.
Did you mean the YouTube video is not playable? Mmmm that's weird because I can view it from here, as well as my other collages, even without Youtube login (private view).
This link works now, thanks!
The issue has been solved by

issue_title: Tracking having hard time following if two identical object has cross each other
issue_contents: I've written a node that filters the result of tracking based on ID. This node will select object "person" with with smallest ID number and publishes its TF.
During the test, I've noticed that:
a) The object tracking is more stable on the "locked" object (see issue
). For example, 1:10-ID#243 sustained much longer then other ID.
b) The tracker is having trouble following the object the two of the same object crossed. For example, at video 00:49-ID#243, 1:26-ID#251, and 1:54-ID#251.
The tracker worked pretty well if objects don't cross each other. (1:35-1:55)

Apparently, the object detection only outputs object tags with bounding box, so the OA has no way of telling which one remains the same object. Still, it would have been better if it can tell the difference somehow. Maybe by some kind of  image matching? I think people can accept that the computer is unable to tell the difference between if they all looked similar (i.e 5 guys wearing suits). But in this case, we're having a significant difference in clothing and appearance.
This is definitely a directly relationship to the person re-ID problem (OpenVINO:

). Currently the re-ID in OpenVINO is having trouble recognize the same person. It often keep assigning new ID to the same person by image method. OTOH, this OA seems to assigned the same ID to different person by spatial method. These two method seems pretty complementary, I think the performance would be much greater if somehow we can join these two components.
Great work on the OA and OpenVINO though, they're opening up so much possibilities!
P.s. To mod: Not sure if this counts as issue or not. Feel free to change the status/tag on this one.

Tracking module has 2 features, single tracking and multi-tracking, while single tracking is aimed to handle local image match, multi-tracking to handle trackers and resolve the issue of occlusions and movements.

Currently single tracking in this project is ready, multi-tracking is a draft framework and still working in progress. That's why you saw single objects tracks well and multiple cross objects tracking has some problem. Please also be noted, there is no perfect solution in industry yet.

If you are trying to use Re-ID for tracking, it would be another story which can be called "track by detect", it can associate detections from different frames, but the performance would be slower than detection, which is not the aim of this project, and also have the same issues on multi-tracking as occlusion and feature vector updates.

If filter "person" in tracking works for your project, you can do the filter between detection module and tracking module or hack in the detection side so that it can save transactions and computations.
It is good conversation so that we can know the scenarios of you guys take this module into, but it's better not start this as issue. Suggest to start discussion or query from mail or other channels.
, do you have some further question? Or i would like to close this issue since multi-tracking is in progress, we can have further discussion then.
I'm good with the closure of the issue. Sounds like you're onto something. I'm looking forward to multi-tracking.

issue_contents: The ROS 2 Dashing build is currently failing.
Here is a link to the official farm
The documentation here:
includes a list of changes since Crystal which might prove useful in debugging.
Thanks for the information!
Just checked the build error, the build machine missed liblz4 which is required from libpcl kdtree algorithm, you can install it by "sudo apt install liblz4-1" before build on ubuntu 18.04.

Also i updated the CMakeLists.txt to include liblz4 as prerequisite. The commit as "c674d9a0e7c2ea1eba1c9b4449790c92dc63ec2d", also re-tag 0.5.4_dashing, please feel free to let me know if any problem.
, may i know if this resolved your issue?
Dependencies for the package need to be declared in the package.xml file as rosdep keys in order to appear in the build environment.
also re-tag 0.5.4_dashing, please feel free to let me know if any problem.
Re-tagging isn't recommended as it can cause issues when multiple identical tags exist in our apt repository. For future changes I would suggest bumping the patch version.
Done improve the package.xml, and taging it with 0.5.4, different tag with previous one, would you help have a try?
, do you have any further question on this issue?
do you have any further question on this issue?
Nope. Thank you for resolving it!

issue_contents: Move to multiplexing scheme for cmd_vel, using either cmd_vel_mux or twist_mux, a la
Done for Kinetic
As an official repository for a pricy commercial product, I found the documentation very unsatisfactory.
Any brief explanation about the code structure would be helpful, i.e., what does what, how it is related to
and
I know the potential users are promising engineers but that doesn't mean they don't need a smooth start.
Have you take a look at the
? ie
and
.  What do you find missing to ensure a smooth start?

Yes, the ROS wiki and the tutorial is the first thing I opened. There are three things we tried the first week when we are working on the Jackal: (1) connected to WiFi;  (2) control it by manually send a Twist message over ROS from another computer so it move; (3) get data from the Velodyne.

(1) was solved eventually but the default bridge setting is confusing.  But (2) is still under going as nothing is mentioned in the tutorial. Joystick seems to be focus but IMHO it's useless for research; (3)  run the visualization viz and everything is easy to follow, but again we are more interested in the raw data and how to turn it on/off, how to change it scanning frequency.
They are just my experience. I send a question about (2) through your official website. If you prefer, I can post my questions here so more people can see.
Don't forget the general ROS guide we have, which as a first step teaches how to manually send Twist messages, and echoing raw data:
Let us know where we can add to the guide :)
Can you clarify what confused you on (1)?  The bridged Ethernet ports are totally separate then the wireless.  For (2), the ROS standard is move a robot by sending a Twist message to the topic
which can be done using a simple Twist publisher as pointed out above. Lastly, all the information for the Velodyne can be found on the ROS Wiki

This is not the ideal place to post questions as it is an issue tracker for the code contained in this repository.  A better option would be to contact customer support or on ROS Answers if you want more people to see.

issue_contents: Hello,

I tried to run simulation of robot with gazebo and amcl navigation demo with default map present in your repository with max velocity of 0.5 m/sec and it worked awesome. I wanted to understand even in simulation if I want to increase max velocity of robot to 2 m/sec or 3 m/sec so is it possible to do gazebo simulation with this velocity ? I tried with max velocity of 2 as well as 3 m/sec but robot drifts alot and also flips while travelling on the path.
Hello!
Great questions! Unfortunately this isn't quite the correct place for it, that's not something that we can inherently support. Your best bet would be to ask the ROS answers community, (
) there's usually plenty of ROS experts there that will be willing to help.
Best of luck!
Hello .

This is Melvin again from University of Detroit mercy. Thanks for your advice with the battery management. I have figured out the charging procedures. After switching OFF the jackal, the charger connector needs to be connected to the charging port on the Jackal. I have to wait from 1 to 3 minutes to start the charging. Anyways it worked well for me. But if I touch or give a hit to the Jackal, the robot will automatically switch ON. (I dont know why its happening without pressing the power switch). On the charging port of robot(the female port) , I can see 4 wires going to the board. But the charger you provided have only two wires coming out. What are those two extra wires going to the board ? Is that the ground? Is that creating the above hit/touch power ON issue?
We have purchased 5 jackals from clear path robotics and all 5 are behaving in 5 different ways.
Let me explain some of the issues we are still facing.

When we launch the "roslaunch jackal_base base.launch" the robot gets successfully up with out any issues. But when it comes to odom, it creates many problems. We are using the odom topic named " Odometry/filtered" and its shows the Position and orientation of the robot.
For moving the robot,  we are using the " rosrun teleop_twist_keyboard teleop_twist_keyboard.py" to teleop the robot.

When we are driving the robot to X direction ( By hitting the "i" key on the keyboard"), the X position on the Odometry/filtered topic under Position. X  does not change. But at the same time the Position.Y is changing in negative direction accordingly.
Also, when we are trying to move the robot to Y direction, the Postion.X is changing.
A screen shot of the topic is attached here. We have driven the robot to 5 meters towards X direction and took the screenshot.( Please note the "-" in the Y values)
With this issue we are not able to run any algorithm on the Jackals. This issue is there on all the five Jackals we purchased from clearpath.
Please help us to resolve this issues.

Also if possible, please send us a document which explains the connection, package installation and configuration, if we are using an external computer (in our case, Intel NUC computer instead of internal computer). We have correct documentation for simulation. But with real robots, the document available is not sufficient enough. One of the mistakes we found in your document is, the IMU tool package should be there to make the jackal_base.launch to work. But you haven’t mentioned about it anywhere in the document.
Thanks
Melvin P Manuel
Dept. of ECE
University of Deroit Mercy
Hi Melvin,

This issue would be better dealt with through Clearpath's support channel since it doesn't deal with the software in the repository.  I have created a support ticket for you and our support team will follow-up with you as soon as possible.
Cheers,
Tony
However, I realized that we do not have an email to contact you at
.  If you could submit a ticket
or simply email
so we can help out.
Thanks Tony..  I will send a mail to your support team. My email ID is
Regards
Melvin
create separate package for custom messages. So we don't create unnecessary dependencies when messages are used from different packages any further.
done

issue_title: Intensity Filter Breaks with Big Freaking intensities
issue_contents: If intensities in a laser scan are large enough, intensity filter will segfault.
Given an intensity of 3e20 (for example), so
results in an integer so large that it overflows. However the negative index results in the segfault
Corrected version:
Hi David, I've chosen a slightly different approach in my pull request, so we don't have to rely on the integer overflow producing a negative number.
Good call. Thanks!
Wow, that was quick! :-)
Sorry for the delay, GSOC keeps us busy these days :)
The histogram is actually for debug purposes only.
patch was modifying the filtered_scan. Is that a desired behavior ? I did that instead:
Please review and close the bug appropriately.

Thanks, this works. I didn't care about modifying the filtered_scan, because the relevant points are removed anyway by the line before (by setting the range to max + 1), so the intensities that I modified should be ignored anyway. That behaviour isn't "desired", it shouldn't matter one way or the other.
I don't have the permissions to close this issue, but I just verified it works now, so feel free to close the issue.
cool, thx for the feedback !
Hi,

First I'd like to say thanks for open-sourcing your MRRP implementation and contributing to the ROS environment. I'm currently testing different options for warehouse robot path planning, and this projects seems very promising. We are working with real robots, so the proof of concept has to be practical. One caveat for my scenario is that the width of some of the paths through the test environment is relatively wide compared to the size of the bots, so the constraint that only one robot may pass through a "vertex" at a time doesn't always hold and should ideally be a function of the width of the path segment instead. Are there any suggestions on how to incorporate this into the system? I can potentially contribute towards this if it isn't too paramount.

Awesome. I'm not at ROSCon ATM but some of my colleagues are, though I imagine they are probably very busy with their own presentations. By any chance do you have links to the code where this is implemented? So I can go through the interfaces and how it's supposed to work etc.

I tested the voronoi graph generation on a gmapping SLAM map of our test environment, it works. Though moving forwards, I think it would make sense to manually CAD the overlaying search graph instead, since the environment is relatively static, there are places that we don't want the bots to go, and sometime's the auto-generated graph isn't so robust to noisy laser measurements manifesting in the gridmap. Something as simple as manually supplying the widths the segments file would suffice.
Be aware that I published yesterday minor changes on the graph generation. The graph should be smoother have a look at the map_invlation parameter.

issue_title: Target points for individual robots at seperate point of time
issue_contents: Hi,
Is it possible to give target points to individual robots at separate point of time rather than giving targets for all robots at once.??
Not at the moment but if you are using just view robots < 20 you can just send all goals again with the new targets. it is fast enough to replan all robots

and
Closing this issue.

Neil

). При необходимости сменить тип подключения с USB на  UART или наоборот.

. При этом получается переводить в другие режимы типа

issue_title: Запуск Клевера с разрешением 640x480, камера в потолок
issue_contents: Попробовал запустить Клевер на 640х480 (вместо 320х240 по умолчанию). На потолочных маркерах.
В main_camera.launch прописал:
С помощью rviz проверил на дизармленом коптере - карту на потолке видит, маркеры распознаёт, положение в пространстве и движение по всем трём осям видит правильно.
Но при взлёте на 1 метр и зависании (с помощью navigate) - коптер взлетает, плавно пролетает target position и летит вверх, пока не ударится в потолок. В rviz это видно также как и в логах:
LPE_VIS_XY = 0.1 m, LPE_VIS_Z = 0.15 m и остальные настройки pixhawk- те же, что и при 320х240.
При полётах с разрешением камеры по умолчанию 320х240 такой проблемы не наблюдается, коптер зависает в target position, a не пролетает её.
В чём может быть проблема и куда смотреть?
А на той калибровке, что уже лежит в Клевере под 640х480, не пробовал?
Попробовал. Всё ещё хуже происходит на стандартной - в rviz в ней кажется, что до потолка ~2 метра а не 3.  И коптер при стандартной калибровке в потолок ещё уверенней и резче летит.
И mocap.z и local_position.z сильнее расходятся - причём mocap более на правду похож:
А подлёт с разрешением 320х240 выглядит вот так (только разрешение камеры поменял, остальное без изменений):

Коптер видит, что по Z он взлетел на 1,5 м, а не на 1м. Но дальше он в потолок не бьётся - только мотается выше целевой точки, и через 30 секунд по команде land() садится. pos_mocap.z и local_position.z не сильно расходятся на всём полёте.
Вообще говоря, есть планы попробовать завести всю эту систему на EKF2. Возможно, какие-то проблемы уйдут.
В любом случае, я изучу твои логи. Хотя желательно, все-таки, приложить их в виде файлов.
Да, конечно, логи высылаю.
3, 4 - попытки взлёта 640х480 с типовой калибровкой камеры, неудачные
5 - когда вернул в 320х240, удачный
Вот ещё лог 2 - взлёт 640х480 с нетиповой калибровкой, полученной с помощью camera_calibrator.
, issue ещё актуален? Как обстоит дело на последней версии образа?
На следующей неделе могу поставить камеру наверх, скачать последний образ и протестить. С тех пор мы летали только на 320х240.

На EKF - у меня по потолочным маркерам летал хорошо (320х240). Но по половым, которые он не видит в момент взлёта - в момент когда маркеры видит в первый раз - EKF начинает думать, что падает - и фырит в потолок. На этом пока завершились мои попытки тестов EKF.
Чё-то новый образ (брал от НТИ, clever_0.16-nti2019-nvg.1.img ) не хочет есть нашу карту.
Сгенерировал карту скриптом rosrun aruco_pose genmap.py. С виду всё хорошо (файл прилагаю
Но после того как я пытаюсь подставить этот файл в aruco.launch вместо nti_novgorod.txt - при запуске Клевер падает с ошибкой:
Ставлю обратно nti_novgorod.txt - ошибка исчезает.
Т.е. понятно, что где-то в карте собака порылась - но её ж такую скрипт сгенерил, и при осмотре текстового файла внешних изъянов я пока не нашёл...
У нас по умолчанию в
выбран словарь на 250 маркеров (DICT_4X4_250).
Чтобы поменять словарь на DICT_4X4_1000, надо добавить параметр
в настройки
, кстати, список словарей.
Спасибо, Олег. Не только
'a, но и ещё и
'a, если быть точным - там он также пытается взять словарь из параметра ноды (стр.91), и именно из-за
'a он и падал, как оказалось.
Ок, карта отобразилась, поеду дальше...
На 640х480 получается маловатая частота расчёта позы карты, имхо:
И это на 1 маркере. Если карту показать - ещё на %10-20 падает framerate.
На 320х240 Клевер 16 выдаёт мне 20-22 Гц максимум. А 13-й Клевер у меня в тех же условиях выдаёт 33-35 Гц.
С 10-герцовой частотой позы я на своём одометре пробовал летать - было сильно "не очень".
Полётные тесты позже проведу, но из-за низкой частоты прогноз на летабельность 640х480 пока отрицательный...
У вас получается ли больший framerate для
из RPI выжать? (может, у меня чего не так настроено...)
Т. е. ты говоришь, что с 13-й версии до 16-й образа частота распознавалки арук деградировала? Мы просто этого не замечали.
Сегодняшние полётные тесты подтвердили предположения о деградации частоты распознавания арук, пока только в POSCTL.
320х240 - висит в точке хоть как-то, 640х480 (поменялось

разрешение камеры) - не держит точку совсем. Отличается только framerate, в rviz карту видно примерно одинаково в обоих случаях. Кстати можно ещё данный тезис проверить поставив framerate = 10 для 320х240 - должна тоже улетать прочь...
примеры логов:
для сравнения, на 13-м Клевере летала более стабильно, примерно вот так:
А калибровку ты меняешь?
Камеры? - Да. Я пробовал и с нашей и с не нашей. С нашей калибровкой всё лучше, до потолка 2.4м, а с вашей она думает, что до карты на потолке 1.4 м.
Калибровка камера должна соответствовать разрешению. На каждое разрешение своя калибровка. (Хотя можно и автоматически camera_matrix пересчитывает,
это, кстати умеет).
Калибровка камеры своя для каждого разрешения, конечно.
Сегодня отключил optical flow, дальномер в clever.launch и estimate_poses в aruco_detect.
Производительности стало лучше, на 320х240 framerate вернулся практически к 40.
После переключения в 640х480 - из
максимум удалось выжать где-то 12 герц.
На 12 герцах в POSCTL, в принципе, аппарат висит. Но быстро летать - не очень получится...
При этом loadavg на 320х240 = ~4.7, а на 640х480 - уже аж 5.9 - 6.3. Т.е., похоже, упираемся в физический предел производительности.
Думаю, на этом issue можно закрывать. Спасибо за консультации!
, а у нас вроде лучше результаты? Вполне возможно, что на разных Raspberry могут быть разные результаты.

issue_contents: Наш программный пакет состоит из четырех основных частей:
Почему считаю что лучше переносить.
Основная идея заключается в том что
Концептуально Arucopose И simpleoffboard являются лишь устанавливаемыми пакетами
И нет причин держать их в главном пакете
А документация должна прикручиваться исходя из того что добавляется в install_ros или другие requirements как и эти репозитории.
Также использование их как внешних пакетов должно наконец стимулировать решить проблему с ros requirements
Вот пока не понял только где должна быть документация
CLEVER - это набор инструкций для сборки преднастроенного образа с документацией.
Так в пакете Clever помимо simple_offboard еще миллион нод.
simple_offoard и aruco_pose в будущем отдельные репы, сейчас пока не потянем.
А что, если я сделаю так, чтобы при push или release в отдельную репу, пакет будет сам собираться и добавляться в нашу deb-репу? Мб даже из релизов можно будет скачать?
Обновил структуру CLEVER согласно этой заметке

# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
import rospy
from clever import srv
from std_srvs.srv import Trigger
import rospy
from clever import srv
from std_srvs.srv import Trigger

rospy.init_node('xopter')   # название вашей ROS-ноды

# Создаем прокси ко всем сервисам:

get_telemetry = rospy.ServiceProxy('get_telemetry', srv.GetTelemetry)
navigate = rospy.ServiceProxy('navigate', srv.Navigate)
navigate_global = rospy.ServiceProxy('navigate_global', srv.NavigateGlobal)
set_position = rospy.ServiceProxy('set_position', srv.SetPosition)
set_velocity = rospy.ServiceProxy('set_velocity', srv.SetVelocity)
set_attitude = rospy.ServiceProxy('set_attitude', srv.SetAttitude)
set_rates = rospy.ServiceProxy('set_rates', srv.SetRates)
land = rospy.ServiceProxy('land', Trigger)
release = rospy.ServiceProxy('release', Trigger)
z = 1  # высота
tolerance = 0.2  # точность проверки высоты (м)

# Запоминаем изначальную точку
start = get_telemetry()

# Взлетаем на 2 м
print(navigate(z=z, speed=0.5, frame_id='fcu_horiz', auto_arm=True))

# Ожидаем взлета
while True:
    # Проверяем текущую высоту
    if get_telemetry().z - start.z + z < tolerance:
        # Взлет завершен
        break
    rospy.sleep(5)
res = land()
if res.success:
    print("Copter is landing")
